cancelUpgrade().details: Only callable by addresses with LendefiConstants.UPGRADER_ROLE

checkPriceDeviation(address).custom:example: If Chainlink reports $1000 and Uniswap reports $1200:                 deviation = (200 * 100) / 1000 = 20%
checkPriceDeviation(address).custom:reverts: NotEnoughValidOracles if both oracles aren't active
checkPriceDeviation(address).details: Requires both oracles to be active. Calculates percentage deviation between prices.

params.asset: The address of the asset to check price deviation for

returns.deviation: The calculated percentage deviation between oracle prices (0-100+)
returns.isDeviated: True if deviation exceeds circuit breaker threshold

evaluateCircuitBreaker(address).details: Anyone can call this function to update circuit breaker status based on current conditions

params.asset: The asset to evaluate circuit breaker status for

returns.deviation: The percentage deviation that affected the decision
returns.triggered: Whether the circuit breaker is now active

params.asset: The asset address to query

getAssetCalculationParams(address).details: Consolidates multiple getter calls into a single cross-contract call

params.asset: Address of the asset to query

returns._0: Struct containing price, thresholds and decimals

params.asset: The asset address to query

returns._0: The number of decimals (e.g., 18 for ETH)

getAssetDetails(address).details: Combines multiple data points into a single view call

params.asset: The address of the asset to query

returns.maxSupply: Maximum supply threshold for the asset
returns.price: Current oracle price of the asset
returns.tvl: Total value locked for the asset

getAssetInfo(address).custom:validation: Asset must be listed in protocol
getAssetInfo(address).details: Returns full Asset struct from storage

params.asset: The address of the asset to query

returns._0: Complete Asset struct containing all configuration parameters

params.asset: The asset address to query
The asset to get price for

returns._0: price The current price of the asset

params.asset: The asset to get price for
params.oracleType: The specific oracle type to query

returns._0: The price from the specified oracle type

params.asset: The asset address to query
The asset address to query

returns._0: The maximum debt cap in asset's native units

getListedAssets().custom:complexity: O(n) where n is number of listed assets
getListedAssets().custom:gas-note: May be expensive for large numbers of assets

returns._0: Array containing addresses of all listed assets

params.asset: The asset address

returns._0: The oracle address for the specified type, or address(0) if none exists

getOracleCount(address).details: Returns sum of active Chainlink and Uniswap oracles (0-2)

params.asset: The asset address to check

returns._0: The total number of active oracle price feeds

params.asset: The asset address

returns._0: The feed address or address(0) if none exists

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

returns._0: The jump rate for the specified tier

getTierRates().details: Returns parallel arrays for jump rates and liquidation fees

returns.jumpRates: Array of jump rates for each tier [STABLE, CROSS_A, CROSS_B, ISOLATED]
returns.liquidationFees: Array of liquidation fees for each tier [STABLE, CROSS_A, CROSS_B, ISOLATED]

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.custom:oracle-config: Initializes oracle configuration with the following defaults: - freshnessThreshold: 28800 (8 hours) - volatilityThreshold: 3600 (1 hour) - volatilityPercentage: 20% - circuitBreakerThreshold: 50%
initialize(address,address,address,addre.custom:security: Sets up the initial access control roles: - DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE: timelock_ - MANAGER_ROLE: timelock_, marketOwner - UPGRADER_ROLE: timelock_ - PAUSER_ROLE: marketOwner, timelock_
initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: This can only be called once through the proxy's initializer

params.marketOwner: Address of the market owner who will have management privileges
params.timelock_: Address of the timelock_ contract that will have admin privileges

params.asset: The asset address to check
params.tvl: The total value locked for the asset

returns._0: true if supply would exceed maximum threshold

params.asset: The asset address to check

returns._0: true if the asset is listed and active, false otherwise

pause().custom:security: Critical function that stops all state-changing operations
pause().details: This function can only be called by addresses with LendefiConstants.PAUSER_ROLE

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

poolLiquidityLimit(address,uint256).details: Only applicable for assets with active Uniswap oracle

params.asset: The asset address to check

returns.limitReached: true if amount exceeds 3% of pool liquidity

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

scheduleUpgrade(address).details: Only callable by addresses with LendefiConstants.UPGRADER_ROLE

params.newImplementation: Address of the new implementation contract

setCoreAddress(address).custom:emits: CoreAddressUpdated event with the new core address
setCoreAddress(address).custom:security: Validates that the new address is not zero
setCoreAddress(address).details: This function can only be called by the DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE when the contract is not paused

params.newCore: Address of the new core protocol contract

unpause().details: This function can only be called by addresses with LendefiConstants.PAUSER_ROLE

updateAssetConfig(address,(uint8,uint8,u.custom:pausable: Operation not allowed when contract is paused
updateAssetConfig(address,(uint8,uint8,u.details: Validates all configuration parameters before updating

params.asset: The address of the asset to configure
The asset to get price for
params.tvl: The total value locked for the asset

updateAssetTier(address,uint8).custom:pausable: Operation not allowed when contract is paused
updateAssetTier(address,uint8).details: Changes risk parameters associated with the asset

params.asset: The address of the listed asset to modify
params.newTier: The new collateral tier to assign

params.asset: The asset to add the oracle for

params.circuitBreakerPct: Price deviation to trigger circuit breaker (25-70%)
params.freshness: Maximum age allowed for oracle data (15m-24h)

params.asset: The asset to register the oracle for

upgradeTimelockRemaining().details: Returns 0 if no upgrade is scheduled or if the timelock has expired

returns._0: timeRemaining The time remaining in seconds

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.
